review.title: Phrase Based Language Model for Statistical Machine Translation: Empirical Study
review.abstract: Reordering is a challenge to machine translation (MT) systems. In MT, the widely used approach is to apply word based language model (LM) which considers the constituent units of a sentence as words. In speech recognition (SR), some phrase based LM have been proposed. However, those LMs are not necessarily suitable or optimal for reordering. We propose two phrase based LMs which considers the constituent units of a sentence as phrases. Experiments show that our phrase based LMs outperform the word based LM with the respect of perplexity and n-best list re-ranking.

metadata.title: Phrase Based Language Model for Statistical Machine Translation

sections.text: It is a challenge for machine translation (MT) systems. In MT, the common approach is to apply a word-based language model (LM) that considers the constituent units of a sentence as words. In speech recognition (SR), some phrases based on LM have been suggested. However, these LMs are not necessarily suitable or optimal for reordering. We propose two phrases based on LMs that consider the constituent units of a sentence as phrases. Experiments show that our phrase based on LMs outperform the word-based LM with respect for perplexity and the best possible reclassification.
